page.title: 07HEALTH CARE IN LUDLOW
page.content: Ludlow Hospital,formerly East Hamlet hospital, was rebuilt in 1971 on the site of Ivy House,the old Workhouse. There are 80 beds, 60 geriatric and 20 acute medical;an out-patients department with visiting consultants,an X-ray and minor injury department. The 8-bedded Maternity unit was closed in October 1985 due to high running costs and lack of midwives. The hospital is run by 5 doctors from the town and a geriatrician. There is a community nursing service run from Dinham clinic and a school nurse. Ludlow also has a homeopath,an occulist,a chiropodist, a chiropractor,an osteopath,an accupuncturist and three chemists.
